#summary Count Function and SaveOrUpdate

= SQL COUNT =

The signature of the function

{{{public function count($where = null);}}}

This function returns an integer, i.e the number of rows counted.

*Usage 1*

{{{

$user = new User();
$user->username = 'manish';
$user->count();

}}}

*SQL Output*
select count(*) from `users` where users.username='manish'


*Usage 2*

{{{

$user = new User();
$where = array('username'=>'manish");
$user->count($where);

}}}

*SQL Output*
select count(*) from `users` where users.username='manish'


= SAVE OR UPDATE FUNCTION =

The defination of saveOrUpdate function is 

{{{
public function saveOrUpdate($where= null){
		$count = $this->count($where);
		if($count == 0){
			$this->insert();
		}else{
			$this->update(null,$where);
		}
	}
}}}

The code is self explanatory, please see tutorial of count(), insert() and update() before using this.
